title: Mumbai's Coastal Infrastructure Expands with New Road and Sea Link Projects
text:
The Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) is witnessing one of its biggest infrastructure transformations, with multiple coastal roads and sea link projects under development. Following the success of the Mumbai Coastal Road (South) - connecting Marine Drive to Worli - authorities are now extending similar connectivity to the city’s northern and satellite areas. The expansion aims to provide faster travel, reduce congestion, and boost tourism and real estate growth across the region.
One of the most awaited projects, the Versova–Bhayander Coastal Road, will connect Versova in Andheri to Bhayander. Once operational, it will significantly reduce travel time between the western suburbs and Mira–Bhayander, while decongesting the Western Express Highway. The scenic coastal route will not only improve daily commuting but also promote tourism and leisure activities along the city’s western coastline.
Further north, the Uttan–Virar Sea Link will extend the coastal corridor from Uttan to Virar. This project will bring the Vasai–Virar region closer to Mumbai’s core, improving regional connectivity and providing an efficient alternative to existing overland routes. It is also expected to stimulate real estate and economic development across the fast-growing northern belt of MMR.
The upcoming Veer Savarkar Sea Link, an extension of the Bandra–Worli Sea Link, will link Bandra to Versova. This new route will serve as a parallel coastal corridor for the city’s western suburbs, further reducing pressure on the Western Express Highway. When connected with the Versova–Bhayander route, it will create a continuous coastal stretch from South Mumbai to Bhayander, redefining urban mobility in the region.
On the eastern front, several coastal projects are being planned to improve connectivity between Thane, Kharghar, and Ulwe.
Together, these coastal infrastructure projects mark a new era of urban development for Mumbai. Similar to how the Marine Drive–Worli stretch became a symbol of modern engineering, these new corridors will shape the city’s future skyline and lifestyle.
With enhanced connectivity, reduced travel times, and scenic routes, Mumbai is set to witness a major transformation in how people and goods move across the metropolitan region - paving the way for a smarter, faster, and more sustainable urban transport framework.
